subject: Re: TestResult extension for elapsed time of test?
msgSnippet: ... just ... Thanks, I can see how that would work.  I m still curious as to how to replace the TestResult with a subclassed version.  It seems that TestRunner
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Jason Rogers <jacaetevha@f...> wrote:
> TFRooney wrote:
>
> > I'd like to extend TestResult to record the elapsed time from
> > startTest to endTest. I'm testing the performance of an app. I'm not
> > a java expert and am having trouble figuring out the syntax to
> > substitute myTestResult for use in myTestCase. Can anyone suggest the
> > proper syntax?
> >
> > Thanks, Tom
> >
> Depending on what you want to do with the timing results, you could
just
> subclass TestCase and override runBare(), then make your test cases
> subclass your specialized TestCase.
>
> public void runBare() throws Throwable {
> enteredSetup();
> setUp();
> exitedSetup();
> try {
> startTimer();
> runTest();
> endTimer();
> } finally {
> try {
> enteredTearDown();
> tearDown();
> } finally {
> exitedTearDown();
> }
> }
> }
>
> --
> Jason Rogers
>
> "I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I,
> but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in
> the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved
> me, and gave himself for me."
> Galatians 2:20

Thanks, I can see how that would work. I'm still curious as to how to
replace the TestResult with a subclassed version. It seems that
TestRunner has TestResult hardcoded as the default. Is there a way to
pass in a replacement?

Thanks, Tom
